title: Implementation Science for Cancer Prevention and Management: Project-Based Learning-Linked Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of public health and pedagogy
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD environment, focusing on implementing cancer prevention and management strategies through interdisciplinary approaches.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze the latest research trends in cancer prevention and management using literature review methodologies
Through case analysis and project-based learning, learners can evaluate the effectiveness of multi-component implementation strategies and propose actionable plans for real-world educational settings
Learners develop a cancer prevention policy simulation model considering cost-effectiveness analysis and resource management factors
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
